entry.title: Sydney Stammtisch Recap Nov '25 (Mastering SAP vs. Tech Ed On Tour)
entry.content:
Usually our #Sydney #Stammtisch events are planned a few weeks in advance (I plan ahead to a fault) but this one ended up being somewhat impromptu.  We had what I thought was our last event of 2025 a couple of weeks ago.  As Mastering SAP often organise great social events as part of their conference (this year a Tech Ed On Tour Event no less) I thought that we shouldn't 'compete' with whatever they had planned.  Well, it turned out that there wasn't an official social event in the calendar so when@AnnePetteroe reached out to us we were already open to the idea of holding a (possibly unprecedented) fifth Stammtisch of 2025.

It was a bit of a scramble but @jeff_t managed to line up a great venue - Sydney Pumphouse - which was very close to the conference venue and close to where most visitors were staying.  We had a great crowd of men & women, both on the younger side and on the slightly less young side.  We had native born Australians alongside people from pretty much every continent (ish).  We had people with blue beards, and people without blue beards (I would say that the latter were in the majority).

Debra from Mastering used the 5mins that she had free on the eve of the conference to come and meet everyone, which was awesome.

As we get more and more people attending Stammtisch my photos seem to do less and less justice to the event.  It was quite dark inside and so I mainly grabbed a few snaps on the terrace.  I thought there were at least 50 attendees but I saw @thomas_jung say on YouTube that there were '70-80' people there, and I wouldn't like to argue with Thomas!

Please feel free to add your own photos in the comments.

A real highlight was the three students who showed having seen @josh_bentley on You Tube shorts mentioning Stammtisch.  Tamer put in a call to someone at Mastering SAP to get them access to the conference somehow, which was just awesome of him. 

It was a great start to what turned out to be a great conference and I do wonder whether we should repeat the same format next year.  Tuesday night is a tough night to get locals out, and we missed many fly-ins because they were due to arrive too late or because their flights got delayed by strong winds.  We might have got more locals if we had given more notice. We could go for the end of Day 1 of the conference, but then there may be other events then (like the awesome RevTrac drinks).

What do you think?

Certainly no-one should be booking flights to Sydney for Mastering SAP Collaborate 2026 without checking with us first 

Thanks so much to everyone who came!

entry.title: SAP AIDevCon 2025: A Day That Redefined AI Innovation
entry.content:
What an absolute triumph yesterday was! The SAP AIDevCon 2025 event on November 8th wasn't just another conference; it was a powerful convergence of ideas, talent, and technology that truly demonstrated the revolutionary potential of Business AI.

The air in the venue was charged with incredible energy and vibrancy. We saw over 50+ passionate participants from more than 26+ diverse corporates and 3 key Indian universities come together. The goal was simple but profound: to not just talk about AI, but to build it.

Igniting Innovation: The Hands-on Experience

The day kicked off with invaluable networkingthe kind that sparks future projectsfollowed by an inspiring keynote address from our VP, Head of APAC. This set the stage for the true excitement: the hands-on experience.

Our participants didn't just attend sessions; they became builders. They immersed themselves in cutting-edge SAP BTP AI services, specifically using:

  • SAP Build for powerful low-code process automation.

  • Document AI to intelligently process unstructured business documents.

  • Translation Hub to instantly break down language barriers in applications.

The highlight was the intensive hackathon. Our audience, a perfect blend of industry experts and bright university students, worked in fierce yet collaborative teams. The atmosphere was one of positive vibes and shared goals, where they had to train, exhibit, and deliver industry-ready prototypes.

SAP Build Sessions

Hands-On Sessions

Breakthrough Prototypes: Solving Real Problems

The solutions developed were not academic exercisesthey were direct answers to critical business challenges. The teams built phenomenal prototypes that showcased the speed and scale possible with SAP BTP AI, focusing on real-world impact:

  1. Dispute Management: Creating smart solutions to automate and accelerate complex financial and operational dispute resolution.

  2. Piracy Protection: Leveraging AI to build robust, automated systems for safeguarding digital assets and intellectual property.

  3. Wellbeing: Developing AI-driven applications to enhance employee and user well-being through proactive insights and personalised support.

This entire day was a masterclass in learning, teamwork, and execution, all driven by the powerful capabilities of SAP Business Technology Platform.

Super Energetic - SAP Community

Gratitude for Our Ecosystem of Heroes

A monumental event like this is only possible because of a dedicated community. A huge and sincere thank you goes out to:

  • Our incredible mentors and volunteers whose guidance transformed ideas into working code.

  • All the brilliant participants for bringing their enthusiasm and skill.

  • The SAP Leadership for championing the vision of an AI-first future.

  • The unsung heroes in IT, Security, and Admin, and each and every hero behind the scenes, whose seamless work made the entire event feel effortless.

Networking

Hackathon - Planning

SAP Document AI Sessions

Hackathon - Presentation

Hackathon - Presentation

Hackathon - Presentation by College Students

Hackathon - Presentation

Hackathon - Presentation

Hackathon - Presentation

Hackathon - Presentation

Hackathon - Presentation

Hackathon Winner

That's me!

What's Next? A Teaser!

The energy and innovation we witnessed at SAP AIDevCon 2025 proved one thing: the appetite for building intelligent, transformative solutions is immense.

This event was a resounding success, and we're already hard at work planning something even bigger and better. Stay tuned, because we are preparing to launch the next, even more exciting, version of AIDevCon very soon!

Keep learning, keep building, and we look forward to welcoming you back to the innovation floor.

entry.title: SAP Inside Track Paraguay CDE 2025: SAP Public Cloud, agilidade e ganhos com ERP em Nuvem
entry.content:
El SAP Inside Track Paraguay CDE 2025 nos regal贸 una charla esclarecedora de @Jean_Chess_IT Jean Tiago Baena, Director de Chess SAP Services y consultor SAP MM con m谩s de 18 a帽os de experiencia en implementaciones SAP ECC y S/4 HANA con actuaci贸n en proyectos globales. Jean, quien comenz贸 como frentista en un puesto de gasolina y hoy dirige su propia consultor铆a SAP en Londrina, nos gui贸 a trav茅s de un fascinante viaje sobre c贸mo SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud est谩 transformando la manera en que las empresas gestionan sus procesos de negocio.


Los Dolores Encontrados en las Empresas
Jean identific贸 claramente las principales dolores que las empresas enfrentan hoy cuando piensan en tecnolog铆a ERP:

  • Falta de agilidad para adaptaci贸n - Muchos empresarios piensan que es muy demorado y costoso
  • Procesos ineficientes y desconectados
  • Falta de transparencia en automatizaciones
  • Preocupaci贸n con seguridad digital
  • Demora en obtener un sistema actualizado - Un tiempo muy largo para tener tecnolog铆a de 煤ltima generaci贸n

Como destac贸 Jean: "Los empresarios siempre piensan que quieren la mejor tecnolog铆a de 煤ltima generaci贸n, m谩s cuando piensan en invertir, piensan que es una dolor de cabeza, es demorado y las mejores pr谩cticas son dif铆ciles de ejecutar."

GROW with SAP: Las Soluciones
Jean present贸 c贸mo GROW with SAP resuelve estas dolores:

  • Implantaci贸n r谩pida de nuevos negocios y expansi贸n - Implementaci贸n muy r谩pida de rollouts para nuevas filiales
  • Procesos alineados con las mejores pr谩cticas globales de la industria - Un sistema "ready to run", pronto para usar
  • Entendimiento de lo que es m谩s cr铆tico y lo que realmente impacta para automatizaci贸n
  • Confianza en actualizaciones de seguridad continua en empresa certificada
  • Adopci贸n de un sistema "pronto para rodar" que crece con el negocio

Dos Caminos: RISE y GROW with SAP
Jean explic贸 las dos abordajes que SAP ofrece:
RISE with SAP: Para procesos muy complejos, compa帽铆as muy grandes como compa帽铆as de petr贸leo, compa帽铆as globales con negocios muy complejos.
GROW with SAP: Donde est谩n las primeras inversiones de SAP en el mundo. Es un sistema que puede ser implementado muy r谩pido en las compa帽铆as. La migraci贸n para compa帽铆as que usan Business One es muy m谩s f谩cil porque hay una integraci贸n muy r谩pida.


Tiempos de Implementaci贸n: La Gran Diferencia
Jean mostr贸 datos concretos sobre los tiempos de implementaci贸n:

  • SAP S/4 HANA Cloud: Media de 4.5 meses (1 a 9 meses)
  • Conversi贸n t铆pica de sistema: 8 a 12 meses
  • Implementaci贸n S/4 HANA on-premise (full suite): 11 a 15 meses
  • Implementaciones complejas (full suite): 10 a 48+ meses

Actualizaciones Continuas: Innovaci贸n sin Proyectos
Uno de los puntos m谩s destacados por Jean fue el modelo de actualizaciones:

Actualizaciones dos veces por a帽o: En febrero y en agosto hay upgrade autom谩tico.
Como Jean explic贸: "Quien hoy trabaja con SAP sabe que un upgrade es algo complejo, demorado, que muda toda la compa帽铆a. Hay que pensar en desarrollos Z, programas Z que ser谩n afectados, muchos tests, costo, tiempo..."
En Cloud ERP: "Las actualizaciones son dos veces por a帽o, y el cliente no precisa planear nada. Los updates son autom谩ticos por SAP. Globalmente su ERP, su sistema est谩 actualizado en todos los pa铆ses de una sola vez."
Las versiones siguen el modelo: 2508, 2602, 2608, 2702... sin necesidad de proyectos de upgrade.

Cloud ERP Inteligente: Las Caracter铆sticas

  • Pronto para usar
  • Actualizado con las mejores pr谩cticas
  • Continua innovaci贸n hecha por SAP
  • Simplificaci贸n de tareas diarias
  • Crecimiento de negocios soportado por SAP
  • Seguridad con actualizaci贸n constante

La Experiencia del Usuario
Jean mostr贸 la evoluci贸n dram谩tica de la interfaz SAP, desde las pantallas en blanco y negro del R/2 (a帽os 80), pasando por versiones m谩s amigables de los 90, el SAP GUI tradicional, hasta llegar a la moderna interfaz Fiori donde:

  • Apps organizadas como favoritos - Como en una web o celular
  • Pantallas totalmente customizadas por perfil de acceso
  • Noticias y conexi贸n con informaciones de la compa帽铆a
  • Videos integrados en el sistema
  • Total compatibilidad con movilidad - Tel茅fonos, dispositivos m贸viles
  • Indicadores de Business Intelligence en la palma de la mano

Mejores Pr谩cticas Nativas: SAP Signavio Process Navigator
Durante la presentacion se demostr贸 c贸mo las mejores pr谩cticas vienen preconfiguradas en el sistema, listas para activar directamente.
Fit-to-Standard: El Nuevo Paradigma
Jean fue enf谩tico sobre el cambio de mentalidad necesario:
"Las compa帽铆as van a pensar m谩s en usar SAP Standard, no m谩s tantos desarrollos, no m谩s tantas customizaciones, porque el est谩ndar es pensado, es desarrollado por muchos a帽os para contener las mejores pr谩cticas."
"Los clientes solamente adoptan y usan, no piensan 'voy a mudar ese SAP porque mi negocio es diferente'. Ya viene con las mejores pr谩cticas y los clientes se adaptan a esta fe de no querer transformar SAP con customizaciones que van a demorar, gastar."
La ventaja: "Si tiene un modelo est谩ndar, puede trabajar en Paraguay, Argentina, Estados Unidos, Brasil, Europa con el mismo, sin mudanzas. Y ah铆 esto es m谩s 谩gil y con costo menor."

Metodolog铆a SAP Activate
fases del proyecto:

  • Discover - Definici贸n inicial del scope
  • Prepare - Preparaci贸n para Fit-to-Standard con Business Driven Configuration
  • Explore - Workshop Fit-to-Standard mostrando procesos y scripts
  • Realize - Implementaci贸n

"Cuando se asigna un contrato, hoy o ma帽ana ya puede usar el sistema. En modelos anteriores, se esperaba 30, 60 d铆as para tener una base de datos de SAP. Ahora, el contrato est谩 firmado y los d铆as siguientes ya puede hacer un logon en el sistema."

Implementaci贸n en Paraguay y Argentina: Jean destac贸 que en pa铆ses como Paraguay y Argentina, donde no hay localizaciones tan complejas como Brasil, "es mucho m谩s r谩pido". En Brasil, los impuestos son "los m谩s complejos del mundo", pero en pa铆ses con pocas diferenciaciones de cargos e impuestos, la implementaci贸n es "muy m谩s 谩gil y con menor costo".
El proyecto t铆pico de Public Cloud es de 4 a 6 meses.
Configuraci贸n sin SPRO: Central Business Configuration
Jean explic贸 el cambio fundamental en la configuraci贸n:
"No m谩s tenemos las configuraciones que conocemos como SPRO. Ahora hacemos configuraciones con CBC, Central Business Configuration."

Extensibilidad con SAP BTP
Opciones de extensibilidad:
Low Code / No Code:

  • Bajo c贸digo de programaci贸n
  • Trabajamos en la pantalla moviendo campos con el mouse
  • Custom Fields, Custom Business Objects, Custom CDS Views
  • Custom Analytical Queries
  • Output Management customizado

Pro Code:

  • Posibilidad de crear apps usando APIs e integraciones
  • APIs como "manera moderna de conectar sistemas, hacer customizaciones, volcarlas para web"
  • "Flexibilidad controlada para atender necesidades espec铆ficas"

Joule: Inteligencia Artificial Integrada
Jean finaliz贸 mostrando Joule, la inteligencia artificial nativa de SAP que ya viene integrada en Cloud ERP:
"La agilidad, la informaci贸n va a estar en la mano de ustedes, de usuarios, de gerentes, de directores. En una reuni贸n de negocios, en un viaje que precisa acceder a los datos, ya est谩 todo en la palma de la mano."

C贸mo funciona Joule:

  • Chat dentro del sistema
  • Consultas en lenguaje natural: "Quiero un gr谩fico de las ventas, cu谩nto estoy facturando"
  • Responde "como personas reales con la inteligencia artificial"
  • "No voy a m谩s buscar un reporte, voy a preguntar: 'Por favor, quiero saber c贸mo est谩 finanzas en abierto, documentos a pagar, cu谩nto se pag贸 hoy' y viene autom谩ticamente"

El Mensaje Final
Jean cerr贸 su presentaci贸n destacando que la informaci贸n est谩 ahora al alcance de todos, f谩cil y r谩pido, permitiendo tomar decisiones de negocio desde cualquier lugar.
La transformaci贸n es clara: De un ERP complejo y demorado a una plataforma 谩gil, con mejores pr谩cticas globales, actualizaciones autom谩ticas, y una experiencia de usuario moderna que pone la informaci贸n en la palma de la mano.

Agradecimientos especiales a Chess SAP Services por compartir esta valiosa experiencia y al equipo organizador del SAP Inside Track Paraguay CDE 2025 por crear este espacio de aprendizaje.


SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

entry.title: SAP Inside Track Paraguay CDE 2025: Ciberseguridad en la era cu谩ntica
entry.content:
El pasado evento SAP Inside Track Paraguay SITCDE2025 nos sorprendi贸 con una charla reveladora de la mano de Carlos Ben铆tez, CTO de Platinum Ciberseguridad, quien con su vasta experiencia nos llev贸 por un recorrido fascinante: desde los desaf铆os actuales de la Inteligencia Artificial hasta las amenazas inminentes de la computaci贸n cu谩ntica



El Nuevo Escenario Digital
Carlos comenz贸 estableciendo el contexto: las empresas dependen cada vez m谩s de sistemas cr铆ticos como SAP, y la superficie de ataque crece exponencialmente con la digitalizaci贸n. La ciberseguridad ya no es solo un tema t茅cnico, sino un factor estrat茅gico para la supervivencia empresarial.

IA: 驴Superh茅roe o Villano?
La Inteligencia Artificial se presenta con dos caras. Por un lado, herramientas como PentestGPT automatizan la detecci贸n de vulnerabilidades sin necesidad de conocimientos profundos. Los deepfakes permiten suplantar identidades y burlar controles biom茅tricos. Y el mal uso de IA conversacional expone informaci贸n sensible de las empresas debido a problemas de separaci贸n entre usuarios.
Pero la IA tambi茅n se viste de superh茅roe: ayuda en la detecci贸n y prevenci贸n de amenazas, protege endpoints mediante XDR, y acelera la respuesta a incidentes a trav茅s de sistemas SOAR. El desaf铆o est谩 en usar estas herramientas de manera responsable.


Computaci贸n Cu谩ntica: El Verdadero Disruptor
Aqu铆 lleg贸 el momento m谩s impactante de la presentaci贸n. Carlos explic贸 c贸mo las computadoras cu谩nticas, que ya existen (de fabricantes como IBM, D-Wave e IonQ), cambiar谩n radicalmente el panorama de la ciberseguridad.
Estas m谩quinas pueden resolver en segundos problemas que tomar铆an a帽os a computadoras tradicionales. El ejemplo del algoritmo de Shor fue contundente: la criptograf铆a RSA que protege nuestras comunicaciones HTTPS, firmas digitales y transacciones blockchain ser谩 vulnerable.

Dos Amenazas Reales
Carlos destac贸 dos ataques concretos:
HTDL (Harvest Today, Decrypt Later): Atacantes est谩n capturando tr谩fico cifrado HOY, almacen谩ndolo y vendi茅ndolo en la dark web, esperando el momento en que puedan descifrarlo con computadoras cu谩nticas.
Falsificaci贸n de Firmas Digitales: Con acceso a la clave p煤blica, se podr谩 generar la clave privada, permitiendo falsificar documentos y contratos de manera indistinguible del original.


La Soluci贸n: Criptograf铆a Post-Cu谩ntica
La buena noticia es que NIST ya estandariz贸 tres algoritmos post-cu谩nticos (FIPS 203, 204 y 205) resistentes a ataques cu谩nticos. El momento de migrar es AHORA, para minimizar el "per铆odo de riesgo" de datos cr铆ticos que deben permanecer seguros por a帽os.
Carlos present贸 el Teorema de Mosca, explicando visualmente por qu茅 cada d铆a que pospongamos la migraci贸n aumenta la ventana de vulnerabilidad de nuestros datos hist贸ricos.

SAP en la Mira
Como concentrador de procesos vitales de negocio, SAP es un objetivo especialmente atractivo. Carlos revel贸 que SAP participa activamente en QUTAC (Quantum Technology and Application Consortium) y ya investiga criptograf铆a quantum-safe, aunque a煤n no hay anuncios p煤blicos sobre la migraci贸n completa.

Estrategia Quantum-Safe
Platinum Ciberseguridad, en alianza con IBM, ofrece un servicio estructurado en cinco fases:

  • Inventario de todos los sistemas que usan criptograf铆a
  • Clasificaci贸n de datos seg煤n tiempo de vida requerido
  • Identificaci贸n de dependencias de vendors
  • Planificaci贸n de la migraci贸n y mitigaciones
  • Remediaci贸n y mantenimiento continuo

 

Conclusi贸n
La presentaci贸n de Carlos fue clara: prepararse hoy es la clave para un futuro seguro. La amenaza cu谩ntica no es ciencia ficci贸n, est谩 m谩s cerca de lo que pensamos. IonQ proyecta tener 8,000 qubits l贸gicos para 2028, suficientes para romper RSA-2048.
Como comunidad SAP, debemos tomar conciencia de que la seguridad de nuestros sistemas va m谩s all谩 de roles y perfiles. Es momento de evaluar riesgos presentes y futuros, fortalecer defensas t茅cnicas, y considerar socios expertos en esta transici贸n hacia la era cu谩ntica.

Agradecemos a Platinum Ciberseguridad por compartir esta visi贸n estrat茅gica y al equipo organizador del SAP Inside Track Paraguay por facilitar estos espacios de conocimiento. #SITCDE2025

entry.title: SAP Inside Track Paraguay CDE 2025: Planificaci贸n Financiera Consolidada y Procesamiento de Facturas
entry.content:
El SAP Inside Track Paraguay SITCDE2025 nos trajo una presentaci贸n reveladora de la mano de Juan Jos茅 Torres, quien comparti贸 soluciones concretas para dos desaf铆os cr铆ticos que enfrentan las empresas con SAP: la automatizaci贸n del procesamiento de facturas electr贸nicas y la contabilidad orientada a unidades de negocio.


El Desaf铆o de la Facturaci贸n Electr贸nica: Volumen Creciente, Tiempo Limitado
Juan Jos茅 comenz贸 con una realidad contundente: los vol煤menes de facturaci贸n electr贸nica est谩n creciendo mes a mes en Paraguay, y la DNIT reporta cifras cada vez m谩s altas de documentos electr贸nicos aprobados. Esto genera un desaf铆o operativo significativo para las empresas.
"En pa铆ses como Chile, si una factura emitida no fue rechazada a las 72 horas, ya empiezan a correr los tiempos de mora. Ac谩 todav铆a no est谩 aplicado, pero en cualquier momento se viene."
El problema m谩s com煤n: contabilidad centraliza las cargas de facturas, muchas veces las deja para los 煤ltimos d铆as del mes, no se toma el cr茅dito fiscal a tiempo, y se generan problemas para el cierre contable. La soluci贸n es clara: automatizaci贸n.

La Soluci贸n: Automatizaci贸n Inteligente de Facturas
La propuesta presentada trabaja sobre cualquier versi贸n de SAP y se basa en tres componentes clave:
Lectura Automatizada

  • Un robot lee los emails con facturas electr贸nicas
  • Una aplicaci贸n procesa el QR de la factura paraguaya (trabaja con XML, no con OCR)
  • Se ingresa a SAP a trav茅s de IDOC

Validaciones Inteligentes La soluci贸n no solo carga facturas, sino que valida:

  • Mapeo autom谩tico del RUC del emisor al c贸digo de proveedor en SAP
  • Concordancia con 贸rdenes de compra abiertas
  • Lectura del cuerpo del mail para identificar el n煤mero de orden de compra
  • Determinaci贸n del centro de costos basado en sucursales
  • Validaci贸n de condiciones de pago e indicadores de impuestos

Rechazo Autom谩tico Inteligente
Si la factura no cumple con las reglas de negocio (por ejemplo, no declara una orden de compra v谩lida), el sistema la rechaza autom谩ticamente con el listado de 贸rdenes de compra disponibles para que el proveedor reenv铆e el mail. Esto evita el trabajo manual de an谩lisis y respuesta.
Beneficios Concretos La implementaci贸n de esta soluci贸n, que actualmente est谩n desplegando en empresas de Paraguay, genera:

  • Aceleraci贸n de procesos de cierre contable
  • Descentralizaci贸n de la carga (log铆stica puede cargar facturas directamente)
  • Validaci贸n del CDC en la p谩gina de la DNIT desde la transacci贸n est谩ndar de SAP
  • Reducci贸n del papeleo
  • Circuitos de aprobaci贸n m谩s 谩giles

Contabilidad Orientada a Unidades de Negocio: El Ferrari sin Usar
La segunda parte de la presentaci贸n toc贸 un punto cr铆tico que Juan Jos茅 identific贸 en m煤ltiples implementaciones:
"Cada vez que conozco un cliente nuevo, le pregunto: 驴Cu谩l es tu estado de resultados por marca? 驴Cu谩l es tu margen por marca? Y no lo sabe, o tiene que andar sacando muchos Excel."
El diagn贸stico es claro: muchas empresas tienen el centro de beneficios mal armado. El centro de beneficios es el dato que consolida todo lo que corresponde al estado de resultados: gastos, ventas y costos directos.

La Propuesta: ROADMAP Analytics
Para resolver esto, la soluci贸n presentada es Roadmap Analytics, construida sobre SAP Analytics Cloud en entorno S/4HANA:
Concepto Clave
Levanta toda la informaci贸n del estado de resultados en la memoria de HANA y deriva las dimensiones a partir del documento contable. Es similar al antiguo m贸dulo COPA (an谩lisis de rentabilidad), pero sin necesidad de crear tablas f铆sicas nuevas.
Antes vs Ahora

Antes: Crear tablas f铆sicas en el sistema con caracter铆sticas e indicadores espec铆ficos
Ahora: Derivaciones en memoria cuando se levanta el cubo de an谩lisis

Capacidades
An谩lisis Multidimensional: Estado de resultados por cliente, l铆nea de negocio, sucursal, marca
Planificaci贸n Consolidada: Integra planificaci贸n de gastos por centro de costos con planificaci贸n de ingresos y costos por centro de beneficios
Dashboards Ejecutivos: Desplegables en BTP con an谩lisis de plan vs real
Reportes Descargables: Estados de resultados en Excel con la informaci贸n consolidada

El Caso Real: Transformaci贸n en Horas
Juan Jos茅 comparti贸 un ejemplo reciente en Paraguay donde cambiaron la estructura de centros de beneficio de una empresa:
"Ahorramos horas de trabajo de cierre de mes para reportes b谩sicos como la rentabilidad de la empresa por unidad de negocio. No lo ten铆a cubierto una empresa que tiene SAP hace m谩s de 10 a帽os."

El Mensaje de Fondo

"Muchas veces SAP te da una Ferrari, pero no la usan. Tienen la funcionalidad, pero no la est谩n aprovechando."

La presentaci贸n dej贸 en claro que no se trata solo de implementar SAP, sino de aprovechar sus capacidades reales. Ya sea automatizando el procesamiento de facturas electr贸nicas para responder a los desaf铆os regulatorios y de volumen, o configurando correctamente los centros de beneficio para tener visibilidad real del negocio.

Ambas soluciones est谩n pensadas para S/4HANA y representan la evoluci贸n natural de funcionalidades que SAP ha tenido durante a帽os, pero que ahora, con la potencia de HANA y la integraci贸n con BTP, pueden implementarse de manera m谩s 谩gil y efectiva.

驴Tu empresa est谩 aprovechando el potencial completo de su inversi贸n en SAP?

Gracias a Juan Jos茅 Torres por compartir su experiencia y conocimiento, y al equipo organizador del SAP Inside Track Paraguay por crear estos espacios de intercambio. #SITCDE2025

entry.title: SAP Inside Track Paraguay CDE 2025: Transformaci贸n gil - C贸mo Acompa帽ar el Cambio en la Era de SAP
entry.content:
Del Control T茅cnico a la Transformaci贸n gil - C贸mo Acompa帽ar el Cambio en la Era de SAP
El SAP Inside Track Paraguay SITCDE2025 cont贸 con una presentaci贸n reveladora de Esteban Hartzstein, Director y Fundador de Tebyon Consulting, quien con m谩s de 30 a帽os de experiencia trabajando con SAP, comparti贸 una reflexi贸n contundente: existe una enorme brecha entre lo que SAP desarrolla en Alemania y lo que realmente se implementa en Latinoam茅rica.


La Pregunta Inc贸moda: 驴Seguimos en 2008?
Reci茅n llegado del ALM Summit 2025 en Alemania, Esteban fue directo: "Hay una desconexi贸n entre lo que pasa en los product managers que est谩n desarrollando los productos SAP y lo que se termina implementando en las empresas. Seguimos viendo implementaciones que parecen de los a帽os 90."
Los problemas recurrentes:

  • Se implementan como ERPs tradicionales, no se conocen los procesos est谩ndares
  • Demasiados gaps y desarrollos Z sin valor real
  • Falta de metodolog铆a: "驴Con Excel y PowerPoint alcanza? No alcanza"
  • Desconocimiento de herramientas como Signavio Process Navigator y Cloud ALM
  • Datos poco limpios, testing deficiente, cutovers problem谩ticos

SAP BTM y SAP ALM: Los Conceptos Clave
SAP Business Transformation Management (BTM) es el enfoque metodol贸gico que combina cuatro ejes: Estrategia y Valores, Procesos y Arquitectura, Programas y Proyectos, y Personas y Culturas.
SAP Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) gestiona todo el ciclo de vida de las aplicaciones: Implementaci贸n (Design, Build, Test, Deploy), Operaci贸n (Detect, Analyze, Correct, Automate), Mejora Continua y Servicios.


La Toolchain Integrada: El Nuevo Paradigma
SAP ha evolucionado de un sistema monol铆tico a una cadena de herramientas especializadas e integradas:

  • SAP LeanIX: Arquitectura empresarial
  • SAP Signavio: Gesti贸n de procesos
  • SAP Cloud ALM: Implementaci贸n y operaciones (el orquestador central)
  • WalkMe/EnableNow: Adopci贸n digital

SAP Cloud ALM: Gratuito, Potente y Subutilizado
Esteban enfatiz贸: "Todos los proyectos deber铆an estar usando Cloud ALM. Es un producto gratuito entregado por SAP, se habilita rapidamente y est谩 en la nube."
N煤meros que impresionan:

  • 2020: 250 clientes
  • 2025: +10,000 clientes proyectados

Capacidades de implementaci贸n:
Project & Task Management, Process Management, Documentation, Test Orchestration, Test Execution, Deployment Orchestration, Change Enablement.
Capacidades operativas:
Business Process Monitoring con KPIs predefinidos, Job & Automation Monitoring, Integration Monitoring, Health Monitoring, Real User Monitoring, Configuration & Security Analysis - todo con procesamiento inteligente mediante IA (Joule).

Clean Core: Los 5 Principios para Sistemas giles
SAP Clean Core garantiza que los sistemas se mantengan 谩giles y rentables:

  1. Business Processes: Usar est谩ndares sin modificar el core
  2. Extensibility: Desacoplar extensiones (desarrollar en BTP)
  3. Data: Controlar datos seg煤n 煤ltimos est谩ndares
  4. Integration: Mantener el landscape confiable y flexible
  5. Operations: Operaciones efectivas y eficientes

El Mensaje: Aprovechemos lo que SAP Ya nos Dio
Las recomendaciones finales de Esteban fueron claras:

  • Entiendan los procesos de negocio actuales antes de implementar
  • Planifiquen la arquitectura empresarial
  • Modelen procesos To-Be basados en est谩ndares SAP
  • Usen SAP Activate y trabajen con sprints
  • Aprovechen Cloud ALM gratuito para gesti贸n de proyectos
  • Operen con monitoreo inteligente
  • Consulten a especialistas - no todas las consultoras tienen el conocimiento necesario

Reflexi贸n Final
"Cloud ALM lo tienen todos gratuito. Signavio puede ser que tengan alguna versi贸n incluida. Las herramientas est谩n disponibles, la metodolog铆a est谩 documentada."
La pregunta no es si SAP tiene las herramientas y metodolog铆as - las tiene, est谩n documentadas y muchas son gratuitas. La pregunta es: 驴estamos aprovechando todo lo que SAP ha preparado para nosotros, o seguimos implementando como en 2008?
El cambio de era en SAP no es solo tecnol贸gico - es metodol贸gico y cultural. Requiere que clientes, consultores y partners demos un paso adelante hacia la verdadera transformaci贸n empresarial.

Gracias a Esteban Hartzstein y Tebyon Consulting  por compartir su experiencia del ALM Summit 2025 en Alemania, y al equipo organizador del SAP Inside Track Paraguay.

entry.title: SAP Champions
entry.content:
Who are SAP Champions?

SAP Champions are:

  • Proactive volunteers with a passion for SAP technologies.
  • Top contributors, leaders, and organizers within the SAP ecosystem.
  • Advocates of SAP communities.
  • Hands-on experts of an SAP product, service, and/or topics.

What do SAP Champions do?

SAP Champions help the SAP Community and its members:

  • Guide and support new members to help them get the most out of their community experience.
  • Share insights and expertise via blog posts, answering questions, drive or contribute to SAP Community group discussions.
  • Lead local SAP Community driven events such as an informal meetup or SAP Inside Track.

What is the difference between the SAP Champions and SAP Mentors programs?

The SAP Mentors share their knowledge and experience to SAP executives and product teams.
This provides an outside -> in view.
The SAP Champions advocate for SAP and SAP Community. They support us to share key messaging and to help drive software adoption in their networks.
This provides an inside -> out view.

Contact us

Looking for more information? For questions and comments about the SAP Champions, please contact sapchampions@sap.com.

Submit a nomination

SAP Champions can be nominated or self-nominated.
Nominated can include being approached proactively by the Community Programs team.
The selection process takes place by the community team, in cycles.

For more information, please contact sapchampions@sap.com.

What makes a great SAP Champion?

  • Top contributor: SAP Champions are top contributors to the SAP Community and ecosystem, serving as distinguished leaders and upholding community ideals and spirit. Traits include being a top influencer, leader, and organizer.
  • Advocate: Advocates and representatives of SAP communities whether through community.sap.com, related sites, social media, or in-person events. They demonstrate passion in everything they do, and inspire others to be like them.
  • Active SAP Community member: Must be a member of SAP Community for a minimum of one full year with an active membership, a profile with a recognizable display name, and featuring a photo.
    Have a robust reputation across SAP Community, including active participation in SAP Community groups (including location groups), questions and answers, blog posts and comments, and events.
  • Expert: Hands-on experts of an SAP product(s), service(s), and/or topic(s).
  • Professional: The span of membership must be marked with positive behavior and adherence to the community rules of engagement. The member's interactions with others must always be polite, friendly, and supportive; this extends to social media and both virtual and in-person events.
  • Continuous Learner: Someone who stays up-to-date and innovates.
  • Events-driven: Due to our renewed focus on events, in the previous one-year period, the member should have participated in several events including both online and in-person this includes hosting/speaking/attending.
  • Well-connected: Have a strong network and reputation across external sites/channels for example, LinkedIn.
  • Eligibility: Anyone not employed by an SAP competitor is eligible for the SAP Champions program. SAP Champions, however, may not be a member of an existing influencer program (e.g., SAP Mentors) or a special council dedicated to community strategy or activity.

Further resources

  • Current SAP Champions meet our amazing community leaders!
  • Become an Event Organizer for those interested, this guide is useful for those with a passion for proactively nurturing a local community.

BTP para voc锚: simplificando o complexo com low-code, pro-code e automa莽茫o.

Por que voc锚 n茫o pode perder?

entry.title: SAP Developer News 20th November 2025
entry.content:
ITEMS

Field report from SAP TechEd on Tour in Singapore  

  • SAP Teched home https://www.sap.com/events/teched.html  

CAP Advanced Event Mesh plugin 

  • @cap-js/advanced-event-mesh plugin https://github.com/cap-js/advanced-event-mesh 
  • CAP Plugin for SAP Integration Suite, Advanced Event Mesh https://help.sap.com/docs/sap-integration-suite/advanced-event-mesh/cap-plugin-for-sap-integration-suite-advanced-event-mesh 

UKISUG Connect 2025 

  • Event website https://www.ukisugconnect.co.uk/ 
  • Agenda https://virtual.oxfordabstracts.com/event/75555/program  

SAP BTP ABAP Environment - Release 2511 

  • Blog post https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-btp-abap-environment-release-2511/ba-p/14257787 

Devtoberfest 2024 winner interviews at SAP TechEd 2025 Michael Teti 

  • Devtoberfest details https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest-blog-posts/devtoberfest-2025-welcome/ba-p/14182817  

CHAPTER TITLES

0:00 Intro 
0:07 Field report from SAP TechEd on Tour in Singapore 
0:50 CAP Advanced Event Mesh plugin 
1:21 UKISUG Connect 2025 
2:45 SAP BTP ABAP Environment Release 2511 
4:00 Devtoberfest 2024 winner interviews at SAP TechEd 2025 Michael Teti 

TRANSCRIPT

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for November 20th, 2025.

[Tom] Hey, everybody. Welcome from the TechEd on Tour. We're here in Singapore today for a CodeJam, our second to last stop on the TechEd on Tour. Next week, we'll be in Bangalore for the big TechEd event there. Everybody looking forward to that? Yeah. Yeah. Yeah, right now we're here in the SAP offices of Singapore. And if you see behind us, there is Ella, the robotic barista, making Rich a hot chocolate right now. So we're enjoying the comforts of the SAP office and looking forward to seeing everybody in Bangalore next week. So until then, we'll see you there. See you there. Bye. Bye.

[Antonio] Hola, SAP developers. In case you missed it, there is a new CAP plugin in town. the Advanced Event Mesh Plugin. You can leverage this new plugin to easily connect your CAP application with SAP Integration Suite Advanced Event Mesh and start publishing or consuming events. Check out the plugin documentation to find out more about how to set up this plugin. I'm including the links in the description. Happy eventing!

[DJ] The conference season is very much in full swing, keeping us developer advocates busy. From organizing and running Devtoberfest through giving the Developer Keynote and running the Developer Garage at TechEd in Berlin and lots more and now many of the team are playing a major role in the On Tour part of the event with a stop in Sydney one in Melbourne and now as you've seen from an earlier item in this very news episode one in Singapore on their way to Bangalore. Over on this side of the world we have coming up the SAP UK and Ireland user group conference Connect. It's a great event it's happening from Sunday the 30th of November through Tuesday the 2nd of December that's right It's like a family reunion lots of discussions take place learning is shared and friendships are made. I'm very honored to be there, I'm running two sessions a hands-on workshop on modeling with CAP's CDS and also a tech talk on local first development with CAP. If you're attending Connect, come along and say hello in fact come to the sessions - the only thing you need to bring is your curiosity. See you there!

[Mamikee] The latest SAP BTP ABAP Environment release 25.11 is here, and it has been available since November 15th. And it's packed with upgrades across ADT, RAP, Fiori, business configuration, integration, and more. So here's a few highlights you don't want to miss. First, big feature drops across the tooling. In ADT, you now get Ghost Text Keyword Completion as the new default. A new editor for email templates. You can create custom email templates using the Maintain Email Template apps and full business configuration set editing right inside ADT. Plus, macOS users, the graphical call timeline for ABAP traces is now supported. In RAP, you can now log base change documents as business events using the new syntax to READ ENTITY, with changes to inspect change operation and define global side effects that refresh UI properties automatically with a single keystroke. Now, this was only a handful of updates. For the full list of updates, read the blog post in the description below.

[Anja & Michael] Welcome here in Berlin TechEd 2025 on site it's so great we handed over from the Devtoberfest now we're here and a lot of TechEd tour stops will join. I'm very happy to have you here, I know that you joined the Devtoberfest and not just joining you did win the Devtoberfest. It's so amazing so what was your experience what did you like, what was your highlight of that? Devtoberfest was incredible. The opportunity to experience the different areas of SAP and to become exposed to those areas was incredible. Having a focus on web technologies, but being exposed to the other services that I was not exposed to prior was very eye-opening and made me a really deep, deep dive into those areas. So I was able to draw some insights that I could reflect back into my work at my work camp. And that's great and now being here on site being on TechEd so what did you ... was thinking or wishing for and what is your highlight here? Oh I was wishing for more and I got more more than that um it was really incredible because it was non -stop sessions um hands-on road mapping um in so many different areas it was uh morning to evening of of of consuming information that I can take back and be empowered with. So I'm very excited to go back and share what I've learned this week. Thank you so much. Thank you.

entry.title: SAP Inside Track Paraguay CDE 2025: SPAIDER Revolucionando Procesos con Inteligencia Artificial
entry.content:
El SAP Inside Track Paraguay #SITCDE2025 nos regal贸 una charla fascinante de la mano de Douglas Figueiredo, Socio y CTO de TEIA Connect, @Teia_Connect quien con m谩s de 18 a帽os de experiencia en proyectos SAP, nos present贸 SPAIDER: una soluci贸n que est谩 revolucionando la manera en que las empresas interact煤an con sus sistemas mediante inteligencia artificial



Douglas comparti贸 una visi贸n clara: la inteligencia artificial debe generar valor real en el mundo empresarial. SPAIDER se enfoca en empoderar al usuario final para que ejecute actividades repetitivas y complejas usando simplemente lenguaje natural.

"La persona m谩s importante en el sistema es el usuario final, y necesitamos darle autonom铆a para que pueda hacer sus actividades utilizando los motores de inteligencia artificial."

驴Qu茅 es SPAIDER?
SPAIDER (SAP Process Artificial Intelligence Evolution Resolution) es un asistente virtual que conecta usuarios con sistemas SAP. El nombre fusiona ingeniosamente Teia (telara帽a en portugu茅s) con Spider (ara帽a en ingl茅s), representando c贸mo esta soluci贸n conecta todos los elementos del ecosistema empresarial a trav茅s de un chat intuitivo.


Los Cuatro Pilares de SPAIDER
SPAIDER-eDOCS: Gestiona autom谩ticamente documentos fiscales electr贸nicos, emitiendo m谩s de 30 tipos de documentos obligatorios, consultando XMLs y optimizando aprobaciones gubernamentales.
SPAIDER-MONI: Monitoreo inteligente que supervisa aspectos t茅cnicos y de negocio, alertando proactivamente sobre problemas antes de que impacten las operaciones.
SPAIDER-ESPEC: Genera especificaciones funcionales y prototipos mediante conversaci贸n natural, permitiendo que cualquier usuario documente requisitos sin conocimientos t茅cnicos.
SPAIDER-TEST: Automatiza pruebas de regresi贸n, ejecutando procesos completos y comparando valores con precisi贸n del 100%. Genera evidencias en PDF para validaci贸n de cambios.



Durante la presentaci贸n, Douglas mostr贸 el poder del lenguaje natural con SPAIDER-TEST. Con un simple comando como "crear un pedido de venta normal", el sistema identifica el tipo de pedido, consulta la referencia, crea autom谩ticamente todo el proceso (pedido, entrega, factura) y presenta los resultados de forma clara.
Cuando modific贸 intencionalmente un dato de material para simular un impacto fiscal, SPAIDER-TEST detect贸 autom谩ticamente las diferencias, las cuantific贸 con precisi贸n y gener贸 un reporte comparativo. Todo esto sin escribir c贸digo ni navegar por m煤ltiples transacciones SAP.


La Visi贸n de Teia Connect
Lo m谩s inspirador fue entender la filosof铆a de Teia Connect sobre IA: no reemplazar personas, sino empoderarlas. En Teia, todos utilizan IA diariamente, los candidatos deben demostrar c贸mo la usan, y cada producto se construye con esta tecnolog铆a. Como Douglas enfatiz贸: "La integraci贸n debe ser transparente para el usuario, sin necesidad de mirar m煤ltiples transacciones."
El Mensaje Final
SPAIDER representa un cambio fundamental en la interacci贸n con sistemas empresariales: democratizar el acceso para que cualquier usuario ejecute procesos complejos, liberar tiempo estrat茅gico automatizando tareas repetitivas, y generar valor real usando IA para resolver problemas concretos de negocio.
驴Lo mejor? SPAIDER es modular y escalable, adapt谩ndose a las necesidades espec铆ficas de cada empresa.

Un especial agradecimiento a Douglas Figueiredo por compartir su conocimiento y pasi贸n por la innovaci贸n, demostrando c贸mo la inteligencia artificial puede transformar realmente los procesos empresariales. A Teia Connect por desarrollar soluciones que empoderan a los usuarios y generan valor tangible en el ecosistema SAP.

Gracias tambi茅n al equipo organizador del SAP Inside Track Paraguay por hacer posible estos espacios de aprendizaje que fortalecen nuestra comunidad y nos mantienen a la vanguardia de la tecnolog铆a.

entry.title: Kick-off SAP Community Belo Horizonte Palestra com Alon Guimar茫es
entry.content:
Tema: Al茅m da Migra莽茫o S/4HANA: do Brownfield ao Clean Core
Data: 27/11 s 19h30

No nosso kick-off da SAP Community Belo Horizonte, teremos a honra de receber Alon Guimar茫es, Arquiteto de Solu莽玫es na Localiza & Co, para uma palestra que promete ir al茅m da migra莽茫o t茅cnica e mostrar caminhos reais de evolu莽茫o no ecossistema SAP: Al茅m da Migra莽茫o S/4HANA: do Brownfield ao Clean Core.

Em um cen谩rio onde as empresas precisam tomar decis玫es cr铆ticas para simplificar processos e preparar o futuro, a jornada da Localiza & Co se torna um exemplo inspirador. Alon vai mostrar, de forma pr谩tica e acess铆vel, como ocorreu a tomada de decis茫o na migra莽茫o S/4HANA e como est谩 acontecendo a evolu莽茫o de Brownfield para a estrat茅gia Clean Core conectando escolhas estrat茅gicas com resultados concretos. Uma palestra que vai al茅m do discurso e traz aprendizados valiosos sobre como preparar o futuro no ecossistema SAP.

Sobre o palestrante

Alon Guimar茫es, Arquiteto de Solu莽玫es na Localiza & Co

Com mais de 15 anos de experi锚ncia em arquitetura de solu莽玫es SAP, integra莽茫o de sistemas e lideran莽a t茅cnica, Alon se consolidou como refer锚ncia em projetos de alta complexidade. Sua carreira 茅 marcada pela capacidade de conectar tecnologia com estrat茅gia de neg贸cios, conduzindo transforma莽玫es digitais que simplificam ambientes corporativos e preparam empresas para o futuro.

Na Localiza & Co, Alon foi o arquiteto respons谩vel pela migra莽茫o para o SAP S/4HANA, liderando decis玫es cr铆ticas e estruturando a evolu莽茫o do modelo Brownfield para Clean Core. Hoje, atua como Arquiteto de Solu莽玫es e l铆der de transforma莽茫o, guiando a empresa em sua jornada de moderniza莽茫o e inova莽茫o cont铆nua no ecossistema SAP e no mindset Clean Core.

Principais destaques da carreira:

  • Lideran莽a em projetos de migra莽茫o para SAP S/4HANA;
  • Experi锚ncia em integra莽茫o fiscal e monitoramento customizado;
  • Desenvolvimento de arquiteturas orientadas a jornadas ponta a ponta;
  • Atua莽茫o em iniciativas estrat茅gicas para simplifica莽茫o e governan莽a de sistemas.

Por que voc锚 n茫o pode perder?

Se voc锚 atua com SAP, arquitetura de solu莽玫es, integra莽茫o de sistemas ou est谩 envolvido em iniciativas de transforma莽茫o digital, esta palestra 茅 para voc锚.

Vamos discutir como a Localiza & Co enfrentou decis玫es cr铆ticas na jornada de migra莽茫o para o SAP S/4HANA, mostrando de forma pr谩tica e inspiradora:

  • Consequ锚ncias de tomadas de decis玫es na migra莽茫o S/4HANA para estrat茅gia Clean Core
  • Os caminhos da evolu莽茫o de Brownfield para a estrat茅gia Clean Core
  • Li莽玫es valiosas para simplificar processos e preparar o futuro no ecossistema SAP
  • Estrat茅gias para reduzir customiza莽玫es e manter governan莽a;
  • Boas pr谩ticas para preparar sua arquitetura para inova莽茫o cont铆nua;
  • Insights sobre desafios reais e solu莽玫es pr谩ticas para empresas que est茫o nessa jornada.

entry.title: Blog it Forward - Mino Kato
entry.content:
(The Japanese version follows the English text.) 绘ユ瑾辫ㄣ缍俱

Introduction

Hello everyone! I received the "Blog it Forward" baton from @sumikko , who organizes community with me, and I am writing this post now. Thank you, Sumikko-san, for this great opportunity! You can read Sumikko-san's post [here] and learn more about the BIF challenge [here].

About Me

My name is Mino Kato. Since "Mino" is a rare name in Japan, people usually call me by my first name rather than a nickname.

I have been working as an SAP consultant in the accounting area for many years. Recently, I have been focusing on projects involving S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (now SAP Cloud ERP), specifically sticking to the "Fit to Standard" approach. I am also an organizer for chillSAP, a local SAP community in Japan, along with Sumikko-san.

Although I am not a developer myself, I love catching up on BTP extension-related and AI-related knowledge that helps users utilize the system more conveniently. This passion motivates my community activities and my multiple participations in SAP TechEd.

My Encounter with SAP

I joined an IT company as a new graduate. After training, the first project I was assigned to along with several colleagues was already in trouble, and we were thrown in as testing personnel. While the business trips and the relationships with the people I worked with are good memories, I suddenly experienced the difficulty of building a system from scratch (or rather, the chaos involving many people when things go wrong).

So, when that project ended and I was given the choice, "Do you want to be involved in Web development or ERP projects next?", I chose ERP without hesitation and went to receive SAP training.

When I saw the SAP system screen (GUI at the time) for the first time, my impression was: "Wow! The buttons are so detailed, and their shapes are perfectly aligned!"

It might sound funny now, but after seeing the chaos, I was moved by the order. Of course, I now know that ERP projects are also difficult and have their own challenges...

Participating in SAP TechEd

Under the mission of "Let's catch up on SAP's new technologies and think of new services" at the company I belonged to at the time, I participated in SAP TechEd for the first time in 2018. I had participated in SAP Inside Track Tokyo in Japan before and felt that TechEd would be interesting. Actually participating, I was able to feel the passion of global engineers and participants from Japan. I thought, "Ah, I love places where we can have these kinds of conversations," which became the trigger for me to actively involve myself in community activities.

Photo from a past TechEd FunRun. I loved these kinds of events too!

Encounter with the Community

During the "Japan Night" at TechEd, I was scouted to speak at SAP Inside Track Tokyo, and presenting on the theme of Design Thinking was a very good experience. I originally loved listening to other people's presentations, but participating as a speaker was an experience that broke down a wall for me. Since that presentation, I think I have become able to jump into various places with lighter footwork.

Long ago, when I started touching SAP, if I ran into something I didn't understand in the finance module, I could only ask seniors at my company or guess the mechanism from SAP Notes information. But now, compared to before, help documents and KBAs are substantial, and we can gain various insights through QA or Blogs in the global community.

And furthermore, it is very stimulating and happy if I can read it in Japanese... Based on such motivation, the SAP Advent Calendar, LT (Lightning Talk) event, and various events of the community "chillSAP" started.

My Favorite Things (Fun Facts)

I love going to the theater. My eyes are glued to living humans unfolding action such as dancing and sword fighting right in front of me. I go to watch ballet, musicals, popular theater, and "2.5-dimensional" plays quite often recently. The opera I watched in between TechEd Berlin the other day was also wonderful. After the pandemic, my spirit of "Let's watch what I want to see live while I can!" has spurred on. I get energy from the stage and turn it into vitality for my daily life.

Sitting in a chair for a long time for theatergoing is bad for the body, but I think doing Yoga regularly helps with that. I like "Ashtanga Yoga," which is quite hard for yoga.

Photo with my teacher Cathy from Hawaii, who I took online classes with during the pandemic, when she came to Japan. (For some reason, she took photos in 3 patterns: vertical, horizontal, and diagonal. This is the diagonal version!)

Answers to BIF Questions

1. If you were 20 again, what would you study?

I might try to get a degree in accounting and get closer to a CPA qualification. In promoting "Fit to Standard," I sometimes feel that having a qualification is easy to understand to be recognized as a specialist in the accounting area. However, learning it after becoming a working adult competes with too many other things I want to learn (English, other foreign languages, SAP and AI technology catch-up), so... But I have no regrets about proceeding to the path of IT by becoming interested in computers while doing experiments and programming in the science department. If I had proceeded to the path of accounting, there is a high possibility that I would not be doing my current job, so I feel it is asking for the moon after all. I will continue to study accounting within the range I can now.

2. What is the most important thing you learned from your parents?

Rather than "learned," it is what they "gave" me. They gave me many books since I was a child, and perhaps due to my original preference, I grew up to be a book lover, which I think is my asset now. I loved experiencing different worlds through picture books and children's books. As I grew up, I read many books including manga, and I was able to know various ways of life and ways of thinking. Being a book lover is also useful when learning new technologies and knowledge now. I love the feeling of my world expanding.

Closing

Thank you for reading this far. Next, I would like to pass the baton to @MikuKawanabe. She is running JSUG's Next Gen Boost community, and I am always stimulated by her powerful activities! I definitely want to know the secret of that energy.
